conditions.summary: Triggers when the player character clicks on an item.
Triggers when the player character clicks on an NPC; the quest can assign a cost to the quest item and take different actions if the PC doesn't have the requisite cash available.
overloads: clicked ${1:_person_} and at least ${2:nn} gold otherwise do ${3:task}

conditions.summary: Raise or lower task state based on time of day.
Triggers when the PC drops a quest item at a quest location.
Triggers when player has a particular item resource in their inventory.
Triggers when a Foe has been injured. Will not fire if Foe dies immediately.
Triggers when the PC slaughters the specified foe or the specified number of foes.
Triggers when player has reached specified level or higher.
Checks if player character is at a specific place; set and do are equivalent.
Triggers when reputation with NPC exceeds value.
Triggers when player clicks on NPC while holding a quest Item in their inventory.
Triggers when player equips an Item or clicks _Use_ on item in inventory window.
Triggers when player clicks on an individual NPC that is not currently assigned to another quest.
Triggers when player reputation with a special named NPC equals or exceeds a minimum value.
overloads: when repute with ${1:faction} is at least ${2:nn}

actions.summary: Gives an NPC the questor role; different NPCs can be given responsibility for separate stages or subquests using **_drop person as questor_**.

Make talk options available. Adds target to the _Tell me about_ dialog picklist and includes the Qrc text block from the _anyInfo_ tag. Linked dialog entries require **_dialog link_** to establish the desired relationship before using **_add dialog_**.
overloads: add dialog for location ${1:_place_} person ${2:_person_} item ${3:_item_}

actions.summary: Adds an NPC portrait to HUD which indicates player is escorting this NPC.
Magically enhances a foe by casting one of the standard spells; this action can be repeated any number of times with different spells.
Changes reputation with an NPC by specified amount.
Unsets one or more tasks so they can be triggered again.
Spawn a Foe resource into the world; unlike **_send foe_**, foe can appears both in town and inside dungeons.
overloads: create foe ${1:_foe_} every ${2:nn} minutes indefinitely with ${3:nn}% success
create foe ${1:_foe_} every ${2:nn} minutes ${3:nn} times with ${4:nn}% success

actions.summary: Spawn a Foe resource into the world; unlike **_create foe_**, it limits the spawning of foe to the times when the player is above ground.
overloads: send ${1:_foe_} every ${2:nn} minutes ${3:nn} times with ${4:nn}% success

actions.summary: Places a Person to a random building in their home town within current region.
Reserve a quest site before linking resources; these are tipically, but not necessarily, an npc.
Cure specific disease on player received by **_make pc ill_** or through exposure to various elements.
Destroys a Person resource; unlike **_hide npc_**, any reference to this symbol in a message block become invalid.

Adds a stock _Any news?_ reply to gossip about the quest symbol. Additionally can create a dialog bridge between symbols; when the NPC chats about a symbol, a new entry will appear in the picklist for the other. For a linked topic to appear in the dialog screen picklist, its symbol name must appear within the linking dialog Qrc block.
overloads: dialog link for location ${2:_symbol_} person ${3:_person_} item ${4:_item_}

actions.summary: Strips an NPC of its questor role; different NPCs can be given responsibility for separate stages or subquests.
Drops escorting face from HUD.
Completes the quest's activity; all quest-related objects in the player's inventory are removed, other quest resources are discarded and the player's log book emptied.
Place an item directly into inventory without notifying the player of the transaction. `from` parameter is ignored.
Gives an item to an entity; the PC can get it with pickpocketing or corpse loot.
Give a quest item to player and displays _QuestComplete_ success message or a custom message. Can be used to give quest reward or just place item directly into player's inventory.
Hide NPC from world temporarily; Qrc messages associated with the NPC still works properly. Can be restored with **_restore npc_**.
Modifies the legal standing of the PC in the current province, or the province where the quest was obtained, by a positive or negative amount of repute.

Adds Qrc text message to player journal. A quest can have up to 10 journal entries; if message has already been added at stepID index, old message gets replaced. A message can be remove with **_remove log step_**.
Inflicts a disease on player.
Converts a quest item into a permanent item that persists after the quest terminates.
Causes the indicated NPC to ignore mouse clicks from the player.
Randomly triggers one of the tasks for activation. The choice is evenly selected over the tasks, but the selection can be skewed by repeating the same task.
Moves foe into world at a reserved site.
Moves item into world at a reserved site.
Moves npc into world at a reserved site.
Plays sound every x minutes y times.
Plays a video
Prompt which displays a yes/no dialog that executes a different task based on user input.
Removes Qrc text message from player journal.
Restore NPC previously hidden from world with **_hide npc_**.
Makes a foe non-hostile until player strikes them again.
Reveals location on travelmap. This can be a remote dungeon or a location revelead in a province with a _magicNumber_, meaning the key to an entry in the Map Table.
Adds a Qrc message block to the set of rumors that an NPC may respond with when asked about _Any News?_ in the dialog screen.
Displays a prompt which user can click to dismiss.
Starts any quest by name or a `S000nnnn` quest by index (repeated two times).
Starts a clock resource timer.
Stops a clock resource timer without triggering the actions scheduled by its alarm task.
Starts a task by setting it active.
Remove a quest Item from player.
Teleport player to a dungeon for dungeon traps, or as part of main quest.
Teleport player to a dungeon for dungeon traps, or as part of main quest.
Permanently disable one or more tasks.
